quiz2.question: variables declared with in a class, outside any method, with the static keyword?
quiz2.explanation: Class Variables are variables declared with in a class, outside any method, with the static keyword

quiz2.question: What is the default value of byte datatype in Java?
quiz2.explanation: Default value of byte datatype is 0.

quiz2.question: Variables used in a switch statement can be used with which datatypes?(select three)
quiz2.explanation: Variables used in a switch statement can only be a string, enum, byte, short, int, or char

quiz2.question: a class declared as private be accessed outside it's package?
quiz2.explanation: No, it's not possible to accessed outside it's package.

quiz2.question: Which is NOT an advantage of Java sockets?
choices: allows only to send packets of raw data between applications
quiz2.answer: allows only to send packets of raw data between applications
quiz2.explanation: The disadvantage is that Socket based communications allows only to send packets of raw data between applications.

quiz2.question: Polymorphism is the ability of an object to take on many forms.
quiz2.explanation: Polymorphism is the ability of an object to take on many forms.

quiz2.question: An interface is a collection of abstract methods.
quiz2.explanation: An interface is a collection of abstract methods. A class implements an interface, thereby inheriting the abstract methods of the interface.

quiz2.question: What is Multiple Inheritance?
choices: one class inheriting from more super classes
more classes inheriting from one super class
more classes inheriting from more super classes
quiz2.answer: one class inheriting from more super classes
quiz2.explanation: Multiple Inheritance is when one class inheriting from more super classes

quiz2.question: A constructor ____?(select three)
choices: Must have the same name as the class it is declared within
answer: Must have the same name as the class it is declared within
quiz2.explanation: A constructor is used is all those three ways

quiz2.question: Fill in the blank
quiz2.choices: _____ is denoted by leading zero in java?
quiz2.explanation: Octal Numbers are denoted by leading zero in java; ex. 04

quiz2.question: Fill in the blank
quiz2.choices: _____ is denoted by leading 0x or 0X in java?
quiz2.explanation: Hexadecimal Numbers are denoted by leading 0x or 0X in java; ex. 0XF

quiz2.question: To prevent any method from overriding, we declare the method as?
quiz2.explanation: Final prevents methods from overriding

quiz2.question: Break statement can be used as labels in Java
quiz2.explanation: Yes; ex. break one;

quiz2.question: Java allows Default Arguments
quiz2.explanation: Java does not allow Default Arguments.

quiz2.question: Which method of the Component class is used to set the position and size of a component?
quiz2.explanation: setBounds() method is used

quiz2.question: Which of the following is NOT true?
choices: An interface can extend another interface.
A class which is implementing an interface must implement all the methods of the interface.
An interface can implement another interface.
An interface is a solution for multiple inheritance in java
quiz2.answer: An interface can implement another interface.
quiz2.explanation: An interface can not implement another interface.

quiz2.question: Fill in the blank
quiz2.choices: In object-oriented programming, new classes can be defined by extending existing classes. This is an example of _____?
quiz2.explanation: Inheritance extends existing classes

quiz2.question: Given a class named student, which of the following is a valid constructor declaration for the class?
quiz2.explanation: This is a valid constructor declaration for the class

quiz2.question: Which of the following is a member of the java.lang package?
quiz2.explanation: Queue is a member of the java.lang package
